ai-tika-s0303t5:1_0: Right away they applied its eyes.
ai-tika-s0303t5:1_2: Citta Hatthisāriputta, thinking, ‘The perfected one’s own mind, if he wishes!’
ai-tika-s0303t5:1_3: From here, Upasena, Uttarā, there is no corruption of sensual desire, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness, and remorse, and doubt. For this is the difference between those who don’t want to decree of sensual pleasures, for arriving, for marriage, don’t apply their minds to understand this,
ai-tika-s0303t5:1_4: One accuses another person their own filthy, interest.’ Then—whether instead of another, he opens it, with a lamp.
ai-tika-s0303t5:1_5: Not seeing the fruit of renunciation, the fruit of giving up all corruptions, the world, and the result of renunciation. And it was taught by the departure from renunciation to renunciation, and the end of the path to renunciation. And in fact this way he expresses this heartfelt sentiment.
ai-tika-s0303t5:1_6: Focusing on this matter, I will take it with you.
ai-tika-s0303t5:1_7: I’ve renounced the rod and the sword to fall apart.
ai-tika-s0303t5:1_8: Six Qualities of the noble path.
ai-tika-s0303t5:2_0: The Book of corruptions are finished.
